channel.title: How do i fix this compiler error?
channel.description: i'm trying to make a command so that only i can do it and this pops up when i compile it [code]client.java:12154: cannot find symbol symbol : variable equalsIgnoreCase location: class java.lang.String else if(command.equalsIgnoreCase&& playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("john")) { ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: How do i fix this compiler error?
item.dc:creator: @AnonymousZ AnonymousZ
item.description:
@AnonymousZ wrote:

No, of course there wasn’t.

I used - code[/code] as an example.

In there, the X stands for any number. I changed it too 7 in the command I sent you too use.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i fix this compiler error?

item.title: How do i fix this compiler error?
item.dc:creator: @john1716 john1716
item.description:
@john1716 wrote:

wait but there was no (“X”) in the code you sent me

Read full topic
item.source: How do i fix this compiler error?

item.title: How do i fix this compiler error?
item.dc:creator: @AnonymousZ AnonymousZ
item.description:
@AnonymousZ wrote:

You’re welcome…

I’ll tell you what you did wrong, so you know in the future.

Where you put - }else if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase&& playerName.equals("Johnn") {

If you look, you missed out the code[/code] after the equalsIgnoreCase

Enjoy!

Read full topic
